# What happens

With helm 3.1.2, when run `helm install` with `--dependent-update` on a local chart file, it install target chart but **does not install dependent charts**.

If you run `helm install` after running `helm dependency update` it will install all the resources which include dependent charts. So, I think this is a bug of `--dependent-update` option.


# How to reproduce

1. Create chart files locally
    * ex. run `helm create sample`
    * It doesn't matter chart's apiVersion (v1 or v2 either is fine)
2. Set at least one dependency
    * When using helm v2, add dependencies into requirements.yaml
    * When using helm v3, add dependencies into Chart.yaml
3. Run `helm install` with `--dependency-update` using helm v3
    * ex. run `helm install --dependency-update sample ./sample`
    * When run `helm install`, it is needed to be in a state of unresolved dependency
    * The point is that the `requirements.lock` and `Chart.lock` does not exist


# Workaround

Update dependency before install chart.

1. Run `helm dependency update`
2. Run `helm install`


# log

Using [this](https://github.com/ryu-sato/helm-charts-sample) sample chart.

This chart is created by `helm create` and add requirement.txt manually.

[log.txt](https://github.com/helm/helm/files/4422665/log.txt)
title: Helm 3 is not possible to install dependent charts by executing `helm install` with `--dependent-update` on a local chart file
